meanings.definition: In the intervening time; during the time before something happens.
meanings.sent1: She finished her homework. Meantime, her brother played outside.
meanings.sent2: I will prepare dinner. Meantime, you can set the table.
meanings.sent3: The cat napped on the couch. Meantime, the dog chased its tail.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the stars appeared. Meantime, the city lights started to twinkle.
meanings.sent5: The rain stopped abruptly. Meantime, the clouds cleared, revealing a rainbow.

meanings.sent1: She was studying for her exam. Meantime, her friends were watching a movie.
meanings.sent2: I will finish this task. Meantime, you can start on the next one.
meanings.sent3: He was fixing the car. Meantime, his son was playing with his toys.
meanings.sent4: The chef was cooking the main course. Meantime, the pastry chef was preparing dessert.
meanings.sent5: The team was practicing hard. Meantime, their opponents were strategizing.
